_metadata.description: All translatable strings extracted from the Review My Emails website
_metadata.purpose: Reference file for comparison with translation editor sourceStrings

contactModal.title: Talk to a Specialist
contactModal.subtitle: Tell us about your situation and we'll get back to you within 24 hours.
contactModal.successText: We'll get back to you within 24 hours.

hero.title: Email List Cleaning That Tells You What to Do
hero.subtitle: Validation tools see addresses. We see patterns, context, and risk. Then we tell you exactly what to do.
hero.description: Clear labels: Keep, Monitor, Suppress. With the reasoning behind each one.

symptoms.title: The Problems That Bring People Here
symptoms.symptom1Desc: Opens dropped, complaints spiked. You validated first, but something still went wrong.
symptoms.symptom2Desc: Half the list came back "unknown" or "risky." Now what?
symptoms.symptom3Desc: New ESP, clean start. But you're not sure what's safe to bring over.
symptoms.symptom4Desc: You tried to wake up old subscribers. It backfired.
symptoms.symptom5Desc: You're on Spamhaus or a major ISP blocklist. No idea why.
symptoms.symptom6Desc: Validators say the list is clean. But you're still hitting traps.

howItWorks.title: We Read Your List. Then We Tell You What to Do.
howItWorks.subtitle: Every address reviewed. Every risk explained. Every action labeled.
howItWorks.step1Desc: Upload via our secure portal. We accept up to 5 million records per batch.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Syntax, domain health, engagement patterns, historical risk signals.
howItWorks.step3Desc: Every row has a label—Keep, Monitor, or Suppress—with reasoning.

labels.title: Clear Labels. Not Just Scores.
labels.subtitle: Every address gets a recommendation, not a probability.
labels.keepDesc: Safe to mail. Active domain, valid format, no red flags.
labels.monitorDesc: Proceed with caution. Watch engagement closely.
labels.suppressDesc: Do not mail. High risk of bounce, trap, or complaint.

whyDifferent.title: What We Catch That Others Miss
whyDifferent.subtitle: Validators check syntax and pings. We go deeper.
whyDifferent.point1Desc: We check MX records, catch-all status, and historical behavior. A "valid" address on a dead domain is still a bad send.
whyDifferent.point2Desc: Spam traps don't announce themselves. We look at list composition, acquisition patterns, and anomalies.
whyDifferent.point3Desc: If you share engagement data, we factor it in. Opens, clicks, recency—all influence the final label.

comparison.title: Standard Validators vs. Review My Emails

testimonials.title: From Marketers Who've Been There
testimonials.testimonial1Text: Review My Emails identified 12% of our list as hidden risk—addresses that passed every validator we tried. After suppressing them, our inbox rate jumped from 74% to 93%.
testimonials.testimonial2Text: We were about to mail 80,000 re-engagement contacts. RME flagged 31% as high-risk. We pulled them. Zero complaints. The campaign actually worked.
testimonials.testimonial3Text: After months of deliverability issues, RME found a cluster of spam traps tied to a single acquisition campaign from 2019. We'd been mailing them for years.

finalCta.title: Ready to See What's Really in Your List?
finalCta.subtitle: Get a clear, actionable report. No more guessing.

hero.title: The person behind Review My Emails
hero.bioP1: I'm YT, and I've spent 17 years helping senders land in the inbox instead of the spam folder.
hero.bioP2: Before Review My Emails, I led deliverability at multiple ESPs and consulted for brands sending billions of emails per month. I've seen what works, what fails, and what the data actually says—versus what vendors claim.
hero.bioP3: Most validation tools stop at syntax checks and MX lookups. They'll tell you an address is "valid" even if it belongs to a dead domain, a recycled spam trap, or a mailbox that hasn't been opened in three years. That's not useful. That's dangerous.
hero.bioP4: Review My Emails exists to fill that gap. We analyze list composition, acquisition patterns, engagement signals, and domain health—then give you a clear answer: Keep, Monitor, or Suppress.
hero.bioP5: No ambiguity. No "unknown" buckets. Just the decision you need to protect your sending reputation.

mission.title: Why This Exists
mission.p1: Email deliverability shouldn't require guesswork. But most senders are stuck between oversimplified validation tools and expensive enterprise consultants who speak in jargon.
mission.p2: I built this to give marketers, growth teams, and email operators a direct path to list health—without needing a six-month consulting engagement or a PhD in SMTP headers.

team.title: The Team
team.description: A small, focused group that lives and breathes email.
team.ytDesc: 17 years in email deliverability. Former ESP head of deliverability. Cleaned lists for brands sending 500M+ emails/month.
team.member2Desc: Former postmaster at a major ISP. Specializes in domain reputation and spam trap identification.
team.member3Desc: Built the pipeline that processes millions of records per hour. Obsessed with accuracy and speed.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.description: Questions? Just want to talk email? Reach out.

hero.title: Validators check addresses. I read risk.
hero.subtitle: Most tools stop at "valid" or "invalid." I tell you what to actually do with each record.

labels.title: Three Labels. Zero Ambiguity.
labels.subtitle: Every record in your file gets one of these:
labels.suppressDesc: Do not mail. Remove from sends.
labels.footer: Plus the reason behind each decision—so you can audit, learn, and defend your choices.

process.title: How the Process Works
process.step1Desc: Upload via secure portal or send directly. Up to 5 million records per batch.
process.step2Desc: I check syntax, domain health, behavioral patterns, engagement context, and historical risk signals.
process.step3Desc: Download your cleaned file with every row labeled: Keep, Monitor, or Suppress—with reasoning.

turnaround.title: Turnaround
turnaround.description: Most lists are processed within 24-48 hours. Larger or more complex files may take longer. You'll get an estimate when you submit.

testimonial.text: Review My Emails goes beyond standard tools by identifying risky patterns others miss.
testimonial.author: Julia S.

faq.title: Common Questions
faq.a1: CSV with email addresses. Additional columns (engagement data, source) help but aren't required.
faq.a2: Most lists under 500k are processed within 24 hours. Larger lists may take 48-72 hours.
faq.q3: What if I need regular cleaning?
faq.a3: We offer monthly and quarterly plans for ongoing list hygiene. Contact us for details.

intro.title: What's Actually Hurting Your Deliverability?
intro.subtitle: Answer four questions. Get a diagnosis.
intro.description: Most senders chase symptoms—open rates, bounce rates, complaints. But the root cause is usually something else. This quiz helps you find it.

q1.question: When did you first notice deliverability issues?
q1.opt1: After a specific campaign or send

q2.question: What does your validation tool say about your list?

q3.question: How did you build your list?

q4.question: How often do you email your full list?

crisis.title: Reputation Crisis
crisis.description: Something specific triggered a reputation hit. Could be a spam trap cluster, a bad campaign, or a compromised segment.
crisis.recommendation: Focus on identifying and isolating the problem segment. Don't blast more email until you know what went wrong.

noConsent.title: Consent Decay
noConsent.description: Your list likely contains addresses that never consented, aged out, or were acquired through questionable sources.
noConsent.recommendation: Segment by acquisition source and date. Suppress anything over 12 months old without engagement.

toolFailure.title: Validation Gap
toolFailure.description: Your validator is missing things. "Unknown" and "risky" aren't actions—they're uncertainty. And uncertainty is risk.
toolFailure.recommendation: Get a second opinion on your list. We specialize in the gray areas validators punt on.

infra.title: Infrastructure Transition
infra.description: ESP migrations reset your sending reputation. New IPs, new domains, new signals for mailbox providers to evaluate.
infra.recommendation: Warm up properly. Don't import your full list on day one. Start with your most engaged segment.

catchall.title: Catch-All Confusion
catchall.description: Your list may contain addresses at catch-all domains—servers that accept everything, including dead mailboxes.
catchall.recommendation: Treat catch-all addresses as a separate segment. Test carefully before mailing at scale.

decay.title: List Decay
decay.description: Infrequent mailing accelerates list rot. Addresses go stale, traps get recycled, and engagement dies.
decay.recommendation: Increase frequency for engaged segments. Sunset non-responders more aggressively.

preventive.title: Preventive Mode
preventive.description: No obvious red flags—but that doesn't mean you're safe. Silent traps and reputation erosion don't announce themselves.
preventive.recommendation: Run a proactive audit. Find problems before they find you.

resultsCta.title: Ready to dig deeper?
resultsCta.description: Get a full analysis of your list.

hero.title: Email SOS Hotline
hero.subtitle: Stuck on a deliverability problem? Talk to someone who's seen it before.
hero.description: No pitch. No upsell. Just answers.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.step1Desc: Pick a time that works. 15-minute slots.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Brief context helps. But you can also just show up.
howItWorks.step3Desc: We'll diagnose, explain, and point you in the right direction.

whyFree.title: Why Is This Free?
whyFree.p1: Because most senders don't know where to start. They Google, read conflicting advice, and make things worse.
whyFree.p2: This hotline exists to give you a straight answer—fast. If you need more help after, you'll know where to find us.

testimonial.text: I was stuck on a Spamhaus listing for weeks. One call with YT and I knew exactly what to do. Delisted in 48 hours.
testimonial.author: Jason M.

intro.title: Inbox Placement Self-Audit
intro.subtitle: What most senders never check. Use this monthly. Be honest. This is how problems get caught before revenue drops.

questions.instant: Do any emails fire within 60 seconds of an open?
questions.stacked: Do multiple automations stack back to back?
questions.openOnly: Are follow-ups triggered by opens only?
questions.fixedDelays: Do you use fixed delays instead of ranges?
questions.dailyCap: Do you cap daily sends per user?

tips.dailyCapTitle: No daily cap = potential spam complaints

questions.tallHeader: Is your header taller than a phone screen?
questions.ctaVisible: Is your main CTA visible without scrolling?
questions.brokenLinks: Are all links in your emails working?
questions.physicalAddress: Is your physical address real and current?
questions.domainMatch: Do your brand domains match your sender domain?
questions.urlShorteners: Do you use URL shorteners (bit.ly, etc)?

questions.sharedDomain: Do multiple brands share the same tracking domain?
questions.clientsDomain: Do clients or partners use your tracking domain?
questions.dnsSecure: Is your DNS locked and secure?
questions.domainWarmed: Is your tracking domain properly warmed?
questions.domainAge: Is your domain older than 30 days?
questions.blocklists: Do you monitor blocklists for your domain?

questions.timeWindow: What engagement time window do you use?
questions.ispSegment: Do you segment engagement by ISP (Gmail vs Outlook vs Yahoo)?
questions.appleOpens: Do you track Apple opens differently?
questions.decayScores: Do you decay engagement scores over time?
questions.suppressCold: Do you automatically suppress cold users?

questions.sameTemplate: Do you use the same template for every send?
questions.ctaLocation: Is your CTA always in the same location?
questions.textImageRatio: Is your text-to-image ratio always the same?

questions.sameHour: Do you send at the exact same hour every day?
questions.sameMinute: Do you send at the exact same minute?
questions.timezoneLogic: Do you use timezone logic for sends?
questions.sendTimeOptimization: Do you use engagement-based send time optimization?

questions.suppressionLists: Did you import old suppression lists during migration?
questions.bounceLists: Did you import old hard bounce lists?
questions.reValidate: Did you re-validate your list after migration?
questions.warmUp: Did you warm up as a new sender after migration?

questions.contentAlign: Do your subject and preview align with email content?
questions.clickbait: Do you use clickbait subject lines?
questions.allCaps: Do you use ALL CAPS in subject lines?
questions.triggerWords: Do you avoid spam trigger words (FREE, URGENT, etc)?

questions.testedSpam: Have you tested how your emails render in spam folders?
questions.imagesLoad: Do your images load in spam view?
questions.plainTextCta: Do you have plain text CTAs as fallbacks?
questions.darkMode: Have you tested dark mode rendering?

questions.cleanFrequency: How often do you validate/clean your list?
questions.validateImports: Do you validate new imports before sending?
questions.suppressBounces: Do you automatically suppress hard bounces?
questions.handleUnknown: Do you monitor and handle unknown/risky addresses?
questions.roleAccounts: Do you suppress or segment role accounts (info@, sales@)?

summaries.strongFoundation: Your email practices are solid. Focus on the few areas flagged below to optimize further.
summaries.needsAttention: You have some good practices but several areas need work before they impact your deliverability.
summaries.highRisk: Multiple issues detected that are likely hurting your inbox placement. Prioritize the recommendations below.

labels.everythingFlagged: Everything flagged based on your answers. Review what applies to you:

results.remember: Remember: Not every item applies to every business. A score of 70 might be perfectly fine for your use case. These are guidelines, not mandates. Use your judgment about what matters for your specific situation.

sosPlug.title: Not Sure What Applies to You?
sosPlug.description: Every business is different. What's critical for a daily sender might be irrelevant for a monthly newsletter. If you're unsure which items actually matter for your situation, talk to someone who's seen it all.
sosPlug.ytDescription: The SOS Hotline connects you with YT, a deliverability specialist who's cleaned thousands of lists and diagnosed hundreds of sending problems. Ask anything.

testimonial.text: Review My Emails goes beyond standard tools by identifying risky patterns others miss.
testimonial.author: Julia S.
